intro: Clematis hilarii var. guaranitida, commonly known as the Guaraní clematis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous climbing habit and showy, usually white or pale blue flowers. The plant features trifoliate leaves with three heart-shaped leaflets and produces small, follicle-type fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
